text: Felipe Campa (born January 13, 1979 in Durango, Durango, Mexico) is a Mexican professional boxer in the Lightweight division and is the former WBC Youth World Super Bantamweight Champion.http://boxrec.com/list_bouts.php?human_id=19107&cat;=boxer He was one of the first ever boxers to be trained by World Champion Roberto García.http://ringtv.craveonline.com/blog/122681-garcia-finds-his-calling-as- a-trainer ==Pro career== On November 6, 1999 Campa upset the undefeated Rudy Martinez to win the WBC Youth World Super Bantamweight Championship. In May 2000, Felipe lost his belt to title contender Fernando Orlando Velárdez, the bout was held in San Bernardino, California. ==See also== *List of current WBC youth world champions ==References== ==External links== * Category:People from Durango City Category:Boxers from Durango Category:Lightweight boxers Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Mexican male boxers
title: Felipe Campa
